rComments: Discovered how much I hate philosophy. If you're not a philosophy major then Petrie will not be a good professor. Otherwise, he's a very nice guy, but the material is dry and repetitive

I've only been in Al's class for about a week now, but his teaching methods are awesome and its almost like class is a discussion among friends rather than trying to decipher ancient thoughts on ethical debates. :) he's a fantastic teacher and his southern accent makes him quite the character.

Loved this class, if you're into the material you should enjoy it. Papers were a breeze, as were the tests. Al made this class interesting, although I could understand how people could easily fall asleep.

So boring and even if you sit there with your ears and eyes glued to him, you will not get what he is saying.  He is SO confusing and his writing is totally illegible (when you can actually read it, it's spelled WRONG!) Coulda been interesting, but instead it was a total waste of time I coulda been sleeping.

Al is MESMERIZING. He is so passionate about the topic, and it is obvious in how he speaks (very slowly and deliberately, for all of you note takers out there). He is a very interesting person to watch, but his soothing voice could easily lull you to sleep. I highly recommend him.

I thought that the class was really interesting. It was a little boring at times and hard to pay attention esp. since it was at 8am. If you do the reading  you shouldn't have any trouble passing the class. His tests are very straight forward and the paper topics were doable and relevant. Al had a good sense of humor and cared about the subject.

this class was not fun at all. nothing was cohesive and i fell asleep every time! it was so early, and his tests were a joke. plus, for a 200 person lecture, he still took attendance. definitely need a good TA to pass this class.
